block.p: Orly Raz, a daughter of Rita and Eitan Daniel Raz of Tarrytown, N.Y., was married last evening to Scott S. Miller, the son of Alexandra and Scott Miller of New York. Rabbi Hirshel Jaffe officiated at Troutbeck, an inn in Amenia, N.Y.

The bride, 29, is the marketing manager for Quicken personal finance software at Intuit Inc. in Mountain View, Calif. She graduated cum laude from Lehigh University and received an M.B.A. degree from Columbia. Her parents own Analytic Recruiting Inc., an executive recruiting business in New York.

Orly Raz, a daughter of Rita and Eitan Daniel Raz of Tarrytown, N.Y., was married last evening to Scott S. Miller, the son of Alexandra and Scott Miller of New York. Rabbi Hirshel Jaffe officiated at Troutbeck, an inn in Amenia, N.Y.

The bride, 29, is the marketing manager for Quicken personal finance software at Intuit Inc. in Mountain View, Calif. She graduated cum laude from Lehigh University and received an M.B.A. degree from Columbia. Her parents own Analytic Recruiting Inc., an executive recruiting business in New York.

The bridegroom, also 29, received an M.B.A. and a master's degree in education from Stanford this month. He graduated cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania. His mother is a manager at Spence-Chapin Services to Families and Children, the adoption agency in New York. His father is a private investor.
